sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀未遂。

sentences.english: She was charged with two counts of first degree murder.
sentences.chinese: 她被控犯有两项一级谋杀罪。

sentences.english: The mother of the murder victim wept in court.
sentences.chinese: 凶案死者的母亲在法庭上痛哭。

sentences.english: Police are searching for the murder weapon.
sentences.chinese: 警方在寻找杀人凶器。

sentences.english: He was convicted of murdering a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀一名警察的罪名成立。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of deliberately killing someone
to kill someone deliberately and illegally

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

sentences.english: We had cake and ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了蛋糕和冰激凌。

sentences.english: a chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 巧克力蛋糕

detailed_translations.english: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs

sentences.english: She often works at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她周末经常要上班。

sentences.english: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.english: How often do you see your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你隔多久去看你父母？

sentences.english: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.chinese: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: subscribe
trans: 订阅；捐款；认购；赞成；签署

sentences.english: My main reason for subscribing to New Scientist is to keep abreast of advances in science.
sentences.chinese: 我订阅《新科学家》的主要原因是要跟上科学的进步。

sentences.english: Each employee may subscribe for up to £2,000 worth of shares.
sentences.chinese: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

sentences.english: The tour of Edinburgh is fully subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 去爱丁堡旅游的名额已经满了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service

name: relation
trans: 关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

sentences.english: I haven't got anywhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我没有任何地方住。

detailed_translations.english: in or to any place

name: dilemma
trans: 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

sentences.english: He's decided to grow a beard.
sentences.chinese: 他已经决定蓄胡须。

detailed_translations.english: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

sentences.english: Two heart attacks in a year. It hasn’t stopped him smoking, though.
sentences.chinese: 一年里心脏病发作了两次，可是那也没让他把烟戒掉。

sentences.english: It sounds like a lot of fun. Isn’t it rather risky though?
sentences.chinese: 听上去很有趣。可是这不是也很危险吗？

detailed_translations.english: used after adding a fact, opinion, or question which seems surprising after what you have just said, or which makes what you have just said seem less true
used to introduce a statement that makes the main statement coming after it seem surprising, unlikely, or unexpected

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

sentences.english: Among his many hobbies was the breeding of fine horses.
sentences.chinese: 在他的众多爱好中有饲养名马。

sentences.english: The printing press gave power to a few to change the world for the many.
sentences.chinese: 印刷机赋予了少数人为多数人改变世界的力量。

sentences.english: Not many expected Ferdinand to be such a success this season.
sentences.chinese: 预料到费迪南德在本赛季如此成功的人并不多。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of people or things
many people

name: what
trans: 到什么程度，在哪一方面

sentences.english: Show me what you bought.
sentences.chinese: 给我看看你买的东西。

sentences.english: What he did was morally wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为很缺德。

detailed_translations.english: the thing which

sentences.english: the grouse shooting season
sentences.chinese: 松鸡狩猎季节

sentences.english: The shooting party set off shortly before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓前不久这群打猎者就出发了。

detailed_translations.english: the sport of shooting animals and birds with guns

sentences.english: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。

sentences.english: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。

sentences.english: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
sentences.chinese: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

sentences.english: strong government
sentences.chinese: 强有力的统治

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who govern a country or state

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

sentences.english: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

sentences.english: Her heart was pounding in her chest.
sentences.chinese: 她的心在胸口怦怦直跳。

sentences.english: a hairy chest
sentences.chinese: 毛茸茸的胸部

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your body between your neck and your stomach

name: advise
trans: 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: sad
trans: 难过的；悲哀的，令人悲痛的；凄惨的，阴郁的（形容颜色）

sentences.english: The relationship had been important to me and its loss left me feeling sad and empty.
sentences.chinese: 这种关系对我一直都很重要，失去它让我感到难过而空虚。

sentences.english: I'm sad that Julie's marriage is on the verge of splitting up.
sentences.chinese: 我为朱莉的婚姻处于破裂的边缘感到难过。

detailed_translations.english: If you are sad, you feel unhappy, usually because something has happened that you do not like

name: another
trans: 又一，另一；另外的；不同的

sentences.english: They must have returned by another route.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定是从另一条路线回来的。

detailed_translations.english: not the same thing, person etc, but a different one

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: average
trans: 算出…的平均数；将…平均分配；使…平衡

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

name: capital
trans: 首都，省会；资金；大写字母；资本家

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: sit
trans: (Sit)人名；(东南亚国家华语)硕；(罗)西特

sentences.english: The parliament building sits in a large square.
sentences.chinese: 议会大楼位于一个大广场上。

sentences.english: He’s got a computer sitting on his desk, but he doesn’t use it.
sentences.chinese: 他有一台电脑放在书桌上，但他不用。

sentences.english: My climbing boots were sitting unused in a cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 我的登山靴在橱柜里，一直没有穿。

sentences.english: The house has sat empty for two years.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子已经空置两年了。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or condition

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sit)人名；(东南亚国家华语)硕；(罗)西特

sentences.english: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

sentences.english: If necessary, we can use aluminium instead of steel.
sentences.chinese: 如果必要，我们可用铝代钢。

detailed_translations.english: a silver-white metal that is very light and is used to make cans, cooking pans, window frames etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Al

name: conventional
trans: 符合习俗的，传统的；常见的；惯例的

sentences.english: Internet connections through conventional phone lines are fairly slow.
sentences.chinese: 通过传统的电话线来连接因特网速度很慢。

sentences.english: Bake for 20 minutes in a conventional oven; 8 in a microwave.
sentences.chinese: 在传统的烤炉中烘烤20分钟，在微波炉里则烤8分钟。

detailed_translations.english: a conventional method, product, practice etc has been used for a long time and is considered the usual type

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: elegant
trans: 高雅的，优雅的；讲究的；简炼的；简洁的

sentences.english: a tall, elegant young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材高挑、举止优雅的年轻女子

sentences.english: You can dine in elegant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在雅致的环境中进餐。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful, attractive, or graceful

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: bachelor
trans: 学士；单身汉；（尚未交配的）小雄兽

sentences.english: Gerald was 38, and a confirmed bachelor (=  a man who has decided that he will never marry  ) .
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德38岁，抱定主意独身。

sentences.english: a Bachelor of Arts/Engineering/Science
sentences.chinese: 文学士；工程学士；理学士

detailed_translations.english: a man who has never been married

name: religious
trans: 宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；修道的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

sentences.english: The prank crammed his mailbox with computer-delivered electronic junk mail.
sentences.chinese: 该恶作剧病毒把他的邮箱塞满计算机发送的电子垃圾邮件。

detailed_translations.english: a box, usually outside a house, where someone’s letters are delivered or collected

name: dizzy
trans: 晕眩的；使人头晕的；昏乱的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的
使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

sentences.english: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
sentences.chinese: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。

sentences.english: She started to suffer from dizzy spells (= a short period when you feel dizzy ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 晕眩的；使人头晕的；昏乱的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill

detailed_translations.chinese: 使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

sentences.english: We still lack a pair of chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 还少一双筷子。

sentences.english: Before lunch he learned the foreigner how to use chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 午饭前他教那个外国人怎样使筷子。

sentences.english: If you want your friend to try something they should pick it up from your plate with their own chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想让你的朋友尝尝某道菜时，应该让他们用他们自己的筷子从你的盘中夹。

sentences.english: The pans were in their accustomed places.
sentences.chinese: 那些锅在老地方。

detailed_translations.english: usual

name: ancient
trans: 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: regardless
trans: 不管的；不顾的；不注意的
不顾后果地；不管怎样，无论如何；不惜费用地

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

sentences.english: When every molecule in your body tells you to run away from the burning building, as a firefighter you have to resist the urge, override it and plunge in.
sentences.chinese: 当你身体内每个细胞都告诉逃离失火的建筑物时，作为一名消防员，你必须克制这种冲动，超越它，投入火场进行战斗。

sentences.english: He mows lawns and gardens for half a dozen clients in Grafton, some of them family friends. And he is an active volunteer firefighter.
sentences.chinese: 他为格拉夫顿六户人家修剪草坪和花园，他们中一些是父母的朋友，此外他还是个积极的义务消防员。

sentences.english: Locally and from the state standpoint, we had some firefighter jobs that were in jeopardy, up in the hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 站在州政府的立场，我们有一些消防员在危险岗位工作，最多时有数百人。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to stop fires burning

name: pineapple
trans: [园艺] 菠萝；[园艺] 凤梨

sentences.english: pineapple chunks
sentences.chinese: 菠萝块

sentences.english: pineapple juice
sentences.chinese: 菠萝汁

detailed_translations.chinese: [园艺] 菠萝；[园艺] 凤梨
detailed_translations.english: a large yellow-brown tropical fruit or its sweet juicy yellow flesh

name: impossible
trans: 不可能的；不可能存在的；难以忍受的；不真实的

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。

sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

sentences.english: He acquainted his classmate with my sister.
sentences.chinese: 他把我妹妹介绍给他的同班同学。

sentences.english: He acquainted his classmate with my younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 他把我的弟弟介绍给他的同班同学。

sentences.english: I, who am your classmate, can understand you.
sentences.chinese: 我是你的同班同学,能了解你。

detailed_translations.english: a member of the same class in a school, college or – in the US – a university

sentences.english: The window opened and a dog's head popped out.
sentences.chinese: 窗子打开了，冷不防一只狗探出头来。

sentences.english: An idea suddenly popped into his head.
sentences.chinese: 他突然想到了一个主意。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly appear, especially when not expected

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: peaceful
trans: 和平的，爱好和平的；平静的

sentences.english: We had a peaceful afternoon without the children.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们不在，我们度过了一个宁静的下午。

sentences.english: It’s very peaceful out here in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 这树林里真安静。

sentences.english: the use of nuclear power for peaceful purposes
sentences.chinese: 核能的和平利用

detailed_translations.english: a peaceful time, place, or situation is quiet and calm without any worry or excitement

name: probable
trans: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者

sentences.english: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
sentences.chinese: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。

sentences.english: Success is highly probable .
sentences.chinese: 成功的希望相当大。

detailed_translations.english: likely to exist, happen, or be true

detailed_translations.chinese: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: identity
trans: 身份；同一性，一致；特性；恒等式

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: profession
trans: 职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

sentences.english: I saw Bob in town with his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我看到鲍勃与他的女朋友一起在镇上。

sentences.english: Put this bag with the others.
sentences.chinese: 把这个包和其他的包放在一起。

sentences.english: I always wear these shoes with this dress.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋子我总是和这条裙子一起穿。

sentences.english: Mix the powder with boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 用开水把粉调和。

sentences.english: You’d better bring your passport with you.
sentences.chinese: 你最好把护照带着。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that two or more people or things are together in the same place

name: minister
trans: 执行牧师职务；辅助或伺候某人

sentences.english: a senior Cabinet minister
sentences.chinese: 资深的内阁部长

sentences.english: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 他在华盛顿与丹麦公使达成了一项协议。

detailed_translations.english: a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries

sentences.english: Is there enough room for me?
sentences.chinese: 有足够的地方给我吗？

sentences.english: We didn't leave early enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们离开得不够早。

detailed_translations.english: used before plural or uncountable nouns to mean ‘as many or as much as sb needs or wants ’
to the necessary degree

sentences.english: Mathew picked up the cup and sipped his coffee.
sentences.chinese: 马修拿起杯子抿了口咖啡。

sentences.english: She put her cup and saucer down on the table.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯碟放到桌上。

sentences.english: Breakfast consisted of half a cup of milk and a dry biscuit.
sentences.chinese: 早餐是半杯牛奶和一片干饼干。

sentences.english: The president of the club came to present the cup to the winners.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部主席来给获胜者颁发奖杯。

detailed_translations.english: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

sentences.english: a story with a happy ending
sentences.chinese: 结局美满的故事

detailed_translations.english: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

name: centigrade
trans: 摄氏的；[仪] 摄氏温度的；百分度的

sentences.english: ...daytime temperatures of up to forty degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: …高达40摄氏度的日间气温。

sentences.english: The number at the bottom is the recommended water temperature in centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 底部的数字为建议性摄氏度水温。

detailed_translations.english: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

name: ceremony
trans: 典礼，仪式；礼节，礼仪；客套，虚礼

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: point
trans: 要点；得分；标点；[机] 尖端

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: sniff
trans: 吸，闻；嗤之以鼻；气味；以鼻吸气；吸气声

sentences.english: Margaret sniffed miserably and nodded.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特可怜地抽泣着点了点头。

sentences.english: Stop sniffing and blow your nose.
sentences.chinese: 别抽鼻子了，擤一擤鼻涕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 以鼻吸气，用力吸入；嗅，闻
detailed_translations.english: to breathe air into your nose noisily, for example when you are crying or have a cold

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: architecture
trans: 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

sentences.english: Lucy turned on the television to watch the evening news.
sentences.chinese: 露西打开电视收看晚间新闻。

sentences.english: They have a television in every room.
sentences.chinese: 他们每个房间都配有电视。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electronic equipment shaped like a box with a screen, on which you can watch programmes

name: editor
trans: 编者，编辑；社论撰写人；编辑装置

sentences.english: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
sentences.chinese: 《每日电讯报》的主编

detailed_translations.english: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

sentences.english: Experts cannot agree on the causes of criminal behaviour .
sentences.chinese: 专家对犯罪行为的原因不能取得一致意见。

sentences.english: I was sure he was involved in some kind of criminal activity .
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他在从事某种犯罪活动。

sentences.english: She has not committed a criminal offence (= a crime ) .
sentences.chinese: 她没有犯罪。

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with criminal damage (= damaging someone’s property illegally ) .
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控犯有刑事损坏罪。

sentences.english: The doctor was found guilty of criminal negligence (= not taking enough care to protect people you are responsible for ) .
sentences.chinese: 这名医生被判过失犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: relating to crime
someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime

sentences.english: a boring movie full of bad dialog
sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

sentences.english: How much does it cost per kilo?
sentences.chinese: 每公斤多少钱？

sentences.english: rooms costing £40 per night
sentences.chinese: 每晚收费40英镑的房间

sentences.english: Admission is £9.95 per adult.
sentences.chinese: 成人门票每位9.95英镑。

sentences.english: My car does 12 miles per litre (= for each litre of petrol ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的汽车每升汽油跑12英里。

sentences.english: The meal cost $25 per head (= for or by each person ) .
sentences.chinese: 那顿饭人均花费25美元。

detailed_translations.english: for each

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

sentences.english: Could we have the menu, please?
sentences.chinese: 请把菜单给我们，好吗？

sentences.english: a three course set menu
sentences.chinese: 三道菜的套餐

detailed_translations.english: a list of all the kinds of food that are available for a meal, especially in a restaurant

name: pancake
trans: 薄烤饼；粉饼；平降（全称pancake landing）

sentences.english: The classic example is tossing a pancake so it flips over in mid-air.
sentences.chinese: 最经典的例子是摊薄饼的时候，颠勺时薄饼就会飞到半空中。

sentences.english: The package says baking and pancake mix, but the pancakes were not tasty without some major tweaking to the recipe.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上说烤焙与薄饼面料混合，但没有添加一些主要调料，薄饼是不好吃的。

sentences.english: They are so-called “ pancake people ”, they no longer concentrate their energies on one area of interest, but instead choose to spread themselves thinly over a large area.
sentences.chinese: 他们就是所谓的“煎饼人”，他们不再将精力专注于某一个感兴趣的领域，而是让自己的关注点浅浅地散布在一个很大的范围。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat round cake made from flour, milk, and eggs, that has been cooked in a flat pan and is eaten hot

name: her
trans: 她（she的宾格）；她的（she的所有格）；她（指某个国家；一艘船）

sentences.english: Jane? I don’t really know her.
sentences.chinese: 简？我不太认识她。

sentences.english: Margaret wants me to go with her.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特想让我和她一起去。

sentences.english: Give her the keys.
sentences.chinese: 把钥匙给她。

sentences.english: Her room was pleasant and airy.
sentences.chinese: 她的房间既舒适又通风。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
belonging to or connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned

name: mist
trans: 薄雾；视线模糊不清；模糊不清之物

sentences.english: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。

sentences.english: He vanished into the mist.
sentences.chinese: 他消失在雾中。

sentences.english: The hills were shrouded in mist (= covered in mist, so that you could not see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。

sentences.english: The mist came down off the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 雾从山上飘下来。

sentences.english: The mists rolled in off the sea (= came on to the land from the sea ) .
sentences.chinese: 雾气从海上涌来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄雾；视线模糊不清；模糊不清之物
detailed_translations.english: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

sentences.english: He quickened his pace , longing to be home.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，盼望着早点回到家中。

sentences.english: Traffic slowed to a walking pace.
sentences.chinese: 车流速度减缓，犹如步行。

sentences.english: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

detailed_translations.english: the speed at which someone walks, runs, or moves
to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous

name: story
trans: 故事；小说；新闻报道；来历；假话

sentences.english: a book of short stories
sentences.chinese: 短篇小说集

sentences.english: We cuddled together over a bedtime story .
sentences.chinese: 我们依偎在一起看睡前故事。

sentences.english: The film was based on a true story .
sentences.chinese: 这部影片是根据真实故事改编的。

sentences.english: Don’t be frightened – it’s only a story (= it is imaginary ) .
sentences.chinese: 别害怕，这只是一个故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故事；小说；新闻报道；来历；假话
detailed_translations.english: a description of how something happened, that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary
to decorate (a pot, wall, etc) with scenes from history or legends

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

sentences.english: The cook and the grocer haggled over the price of eggs.
sentences.chinese: 厨师和杂货商为蛋价计较个没完。

sentences.english: He never overcharged when I went shopping in his grocer.
sentences.chinese: 我去他的杂货店买东西时他从不向我乱索价。

sentences.english: Just as our exchanges with the local grocer free us from backbreaking farm work, so do imports from around the world move us even more toward the very economic specialization that enriches us.
sentences.chinese: 就好像我们与当地的杂货店交易，我们就不用非常辛苦地从事农业劳动，来自全世界的进口品让我们更快地走向经济专业化，使我们富裕。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells food and other things used in the home

sentences.english: the lively New Year celebrations in the city centre
sentences.chinese: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

detailed_translations.english: an occasion or party when you celebrate something

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

sentences.english: I don’t smoke and I don’t drink much.
sentences.chinese: 我不吸烟，酒也喝得不多。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I smoke?
sentences.chinese: 我抽烟你介意吗？

sentences.english: He sat on the grass smoking a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在草地上吸烟。

sentences.english: He admitted that he had smoked marijuana when he was a student.
sentences.chinese: 他承认在读书时吸过大麻。

sentences.english: a smoking chimney
sentences.chinese: 冒烟的烟囱

sentences.english: Smoke from burning fields drifted across nearby roads.
sentences.chinese: 地里燃烧产生的烟雾飘到了附近的公路上。

detailed_translations.english: to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit
white, grey or black gas that is produced by something burning

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: cottage
trans: 小屋；村舍；（农舍式的）小别墅

sentences.english: a country cottage
sentences.chinese: 乡间小屋

sentences.english: We’re staying in a holiday cottage in Dorset.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在多塞特的一个度假小别墅里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小屋；村舍；（农舍式的）小别墅
detailed_translations.english: a small house in the country

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: lovely
trans: 可爱的；令人愉快的；爱恋的；秀丽的，优美的

sentences.english: She had a lovely face.
sentences.chinese: 她有一张漂亮的脸蛋。

sentences.english: What a lovely house!
sentences.chinese: 多么漂亮的房子啊！

sentences.english: You look lovely in that dress.
sentences.chinese: 你穿那条连衣裙很漂亮。

sentences.english: He was a lovely little boy.
sentences.chinese: 他是个可爱的小男孩。

sentences.english: What a lovely day!
sentences.chinese: 多好的天气啊！

sentences.english: Thank you for a lovely evening.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你让我们度过了一个美好的夜晚。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful or attractive

name: rude
trans: 粗鲁的；无礼的；狂暴的；未开化的

sentences.english: a rude remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的话

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

detailed_translations.english: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

sentences.english: I’d love to go into nursing.
sentences.chinese: 我很乐意从事护理行业。

sentences.english: the nursing profession
sentences.chinese: 护理专业

sentences.english: psychiatric nursing
sentences.chinese: 精神病人的护理

detailed_translations.english: the job or skill of looking after people who are ill, injured, or old

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: yourselves
trans: 你们自己；你们本人（yourself的复数）

sentences.english: Believe in yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 相信你们自己。

sentences.english: I need not press the urgency of the matter on you, as I konw you are fully aware of it yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我无需向你们强调此事的急迫性，因为我知道，你们自己对此完全了解。

sentences.english: But what is ultimately most important here is that you are asking the question —not just of me but of yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 但是我在这儿说的最重要的是：你们在问那些问题——不仅是问我，而是在问你们自己。

detailed_translations.chinese: 你们自己；你们本人（yourself的复数）

sentences.english: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.chinese: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.english: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.chinese: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.english: He hadn’t always been a butler.
sentences.chinese: 他并不是一直当管家。

sentences.english: I’ll always remember that day.
sentences.chinese: 我会永远记住那一天。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, at all times, or every time

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: distinction
trans: 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things
